description:
OpenID Connect identity provider, let you register and set up permissions and authorization options for OpenID Connect protocol.

https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html

clientAuthenticationMethod.title: Client Authentication method
clientAuthenticationMethod.description: Method for authenticating client at the token endpoint

wellKnownUri.title: Well-Known Endpoint
wellKnownUri.description:
OpenID Connect Well-Known Endpoint '/.well-known/openid-configuration' to get OpenID Provider Configuration and autodiscover the endpoints.
For settings configured both in this form and received from the well-known endpoint, the auto discovered values are used.

userAuthorizationUri.title: Authorization Endpoint
userAuthorizationUri.description: OAuth 2.0 Authorization Endpoint '/authorize' that initializes OIDC authentication flow

accessTokenUri.title: Token Endpoint
accessTokenUri.description: OAuth 2.0 Token Endpoint '/token' that exchanges authorization code for a token (Authorization Code Flow)

userProfileUri.title: UserInfo Endpoint
userProfileUri.description: OpenID Connect UserInfo Endpoint '/userinfo' that returns claims about the authenticated End-User

logoutUri.title: End Session Endpoint
logoutUri.description:
OpenID Connect 'End Session Endpoint' that sign the End-User out of the OIDC Provider.
The OIDC must implement this specification to allow redirect

responseType.title: OpenID Connect Flow
responseType.description: OpenId Connect Authentication Flow (Authorization Code or Implicit based on the response_type parameter)

responseMode.title: OpenID response mode
responseMode.description: Specifies how the OIDC provider should return the authorization params to AM.</br>Leave default to pick automatically based on the response_type

encodeRedirectUri.title: Should the redirect_uri parameter be url-encoded ?

useIdTokenForUserInfo.title: Use the ID Token to retrieve user information ? (response_type=id_token or UserInfo Endpoint is missing)

signature.title: Signature
signature.description: Define how the ID Token has been signed.

titleMap.HMAC_HS256: HS256 - HMAC with SHA-256, requires 256+ bit secret
titleMap.HMAC_HS384: HS384 - HMAC with SHA-384, requires 384+ bit secret
titleMap.HMAC_HS512: HS512 - HMAC with SHA-512, requires 512+ bit secret

publicKeyResolver.title: Public Key resolver
publicKeyResolver.description: Define how the ID Token (JWT) will be verify

titleMap.GIVEN_KEY: GIVEN_KEY: You must provide a signature key (PEM format or HMAC secret key)
titleMap.JWKS_URL: JWKS_URL: Retrieve JWKS from URL (Basically, URL ending with '/.well-known/jwks.json')

resolverParameter.title: Resolver parameter
resolverParameter.description: Set the signature key (GIVEN_KEY) or a JWKS URL (JWKS_URL) following selected resolver.

scopes.title: Scopes
scopes.description: Scopes let you specify exactly what type of access you need. Scopes limit access for OAuth tokens.

connectTimeout.title: HTTP Client connect timeout
connectTimeout.description: Duration of time in milliseconds that connects will block. (default 10000 ms)

idleTimeout.title: HTTP Client idle timeout
idleTimeout.description: Duration of time in milliseconds that request will hold. (default 10000 ms)

maxPoolSize.title: HTTP Client max pool size
maxPoolSize.description: Maximum pool of connections can grow to. (default 200)

codeChallengeMethod.title: Code challenge method
codeChallengeMethod.description: Type of challenge for PKCE. Leave 'None' to opt out of using PKCE
